# "Luminous Trails: Embracing Life's Transient Beauty"
## Scripture
"And God said, 'Let there be lights in the vault of the sky to separate the day from the night, and let them serve as signs to mark sacred times, and days and years.'" - Genesis 1:14

## Reflection
As we gaze up at the night sky, we're reminded of the transient nature of life. Comets, with their luminous trails, briefly illuminate the darkness, only to disappear into the vast expanse of space. Similarly, our lives on earth are but a fleeting moment in the grand tapestry of time. Yet, in this brevity, we find beauty and purpose. Just as comets leave behind a glowing trail, our lives can leave a lasting impact on those around us. As followers of Jesus, we're called to shine brightly, illuminating the path for others, even if only for a brief moment.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, thank you for the celestial reminders of life's transient nature. Help us to cherish each moment, using our time to shine your light and leave a lasting impact on those around us. As we gaze up at the night sky, fill us with a sense of wonder and awe, and remind us that our lives, though brief, are part of your eternal plan. May we embracing the beauty of our fleeting lives, and may our luminous trails point others to your eternal love and grace.
